Question
========

A right triangle is drawn such that its hypotenuse connects the origin to the edge of the unit circle in the first quadrant. The acute angle at the origin has a measure of `r deg1`Â°. What is the measure, in degrees, of the other acute angle of the right triangle?

```{r,echo=F,fig.dim=c(6,6)}
par(mar=c(0,0,0,0),pty="s")
dd = 1.2
plot(0,0,"n",xlim=c(-dd,dd),ylim=c(-dd,dd),axes=F,ann=F)
for(i in seq(-dd,dd,0.1)){
    lines(c(i,i),c(-dd,dd),col="grey",lwd=0.5)
    lines(c(-dd,dd),c(i,i),col="grey",lwd=0.5)
}
for(i in seq(-1,1,1)){
    lines(c(i,i),c(-dd,dd),col="darkgrey",lwd=1)
    lines(c(-dd,dd),c(i,i),col="darkgrey",lwd=1)
}
arrows(-dd*1.04,0,dd*1.04,0,0.1,10,3,lwd=3)
arrows(0,-dd*1.04,0,dd*1.04,0.1,10,3,lwd=3)
text(1.02,-0.04,"1")
text(-0.03,1.03,"1")
text(1.17,-0.04,"x")
text(-0.03,1.17,"y")

th = seq(0,2*pi,pi/360)
lines(cos(th),sin(th))

```
